text: Ceratozamia matudae is a species of plant in the family Zamiaceae. It is native to Mexico, where it occurs in the states of Chiapas and Oaxaca, and its distribution extends into western Guatemala. Though some populations are in protected areas, the species is still affected by habitat loss as forest is cleared for plantations.Vovides, A. & Chemnick, J. 2010. Ceratozamia matudae. The IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2015.2.
